# setTextColor(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the text’s color.

## Declaration

```swift
func setTextColor(_ color: UIColor?)
```

## Parameters

- **color**: The color to be applied to the text field’s text. Specifying `nil` removes the color and returns the text to the color specified in the storyboard file. The default color is white.

## Discussion

This method defines the default color of the entire string. The text field uses this color unless you explicitly override it in an attributed string using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/NSForegroundColorAttributeName] attribute.

## Setting the Text

- **setText(_:)**: Sets the text displayed by the text field.
- **setAttributedText(_:)**: Sets the styled text displayed by the text field.
